snippet.textDisplay: @Bob Man your analogy may of awnsered my other question regarding vax protection . So the specific mouse trap will only recognise a mouse with one ear and and 1 eye. Natural infection mouse trap will recognise the one eared mouse even if it has 2 eyes. As this mouse trap has broader recognition because all 29 proteins having been presented in natural infection.  So vax fail following mutation where as naturally borne will be more tolerant

snippet.textDisplay: It's been found that the half life of memory b cells mirror that of memory b cells created after SARS 1 which currantly are at 17 years plus. Excellent article in nature indicating probably life long protection following natural infection due to good cross reactivity as well against mutations.

snippet.textDisplay: @johnny chang one thing in our favour is this virus doesnt mutate as readily or to the same degree as flu so given the strength of cross reactivity seen with sars 1, immunity should last better than flu specially once sterlizing vacs come on line

snippet.textDisplay: @L. G. see so much of this antibody fear being pushed. It only takes a little thought to realise antibodies level must drop else our blood would be like pea soup from all previous infections. They only remain high for a while due to the chance of reintroduction while virus in circulation. Having recovered from covid it dawned on me very quickly having been symptomatic on day 3 4 and 5 and recovered by day 6 it wasnt antibodies that did the work and allowed me and my family to recover
snippet.textOriginal: @L. G. see so much of this antibody fear being pushed.
